clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Rivaroxaban Use and Potential Adverse Outcomes in Routine Clinical Pratice (UK)
clinical_study.official_title: A Proposed Pharmacoepidemiological Study of Rivaroxaban Use and Potential Adverse Outcomes in Routine Clinical Pratice in the United Kingdom.

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective cohort study will provide information about: characteristics of Rivaroxaban use in patients who are prescribed Rivaroxaban for the first time compared to patients who are prescribed Warfarin for the first time, the occurrence of intracranial haemorrhage, gastrointestinal and urogenital bleeding, and the occurrence of non-infective liver disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Major bleedings: Intracranial haemorrhage, Gastrointestinal bleeding and Urogenital bleeding
primary_outcome.time_frame: The two cohorts will be followed up from the index date until 12 months after the end of the extended enrollment period for potential outcomes
The two cohorts will be followed up from the index date until 12 months after the end of the extended enrollment period for potential outcomes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The two cohorts will be followed up from the index date until 12 months after the end of the extended enrolment period for potential outcomes

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness outcomes: Deep vein thrombosis and Pulmonary embolism, Ischaemic stroke, Myocardial infarction, Death
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The two cohorts will be followed up from the index date until 12 months after the end of the extended enrolment period for potential outcomes.

intervention.description: Patients who have been prescribed Rivaroxaban for the first time, divided in two subgroups: Naïve and Non Naïve. The Non Naïve are also divided in two subgroups: Recent switchers and Distant switchers.
Patients who have been prescribed Warfarin for the first time, divided in two subgroups: Naïve and Non Naïve. The Non Naïve are also divided in two subgroups: Recent switchers and Distant switchers.

study_pop.textblock: All male and female patient aged 2 to 89 years who have been enrolled in the database (GePaRD) for at least 1 year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients between 2 and 89 years, who have been prescribed for the first time either Rivaroxaban or Warfarin.
